body_html:
Thanks for reaching back. Performance perhaps won't be an issue when regex
is working since we could filter relevant out each time.

As for zooming, I remember it works in 0.5, at least. It is nice to have
that feature around, since sometime, the vibration in the network may cause
activation or parameters to reach a far larger value than the values when
the network stablizes. To be able to zoom in sometimes helps a lot,
otherwise, the stable values are indiscernable.

On 11 August 2016 at 01:26, Daniel W Mane notifications@github.com wrote:

Zoom doesn't work on those histograms. That's currently working as
intended. In a future release, we will rename the histograms to
"distribution charts" and add in true histogram charts which are much
nicer.

For the performance issues: in the future, we hope to improve performance
for large numbers of charts in a single group, but it's not on the
immediate roadmap. We are actively working on ways to make it easier to set
up the tag groups.

You're right that the regex filter doesn't work on the histogram tab.
We'll dig into it and report back.

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#3592 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ACUNSZ0BIXc5niYyFkIxl2ar39q7_xtvks5qegnhgaJpZM4JY_b9
.

body:
Thanks for reaching back. Performance perhaps won't be an issue when regex
is working since we could filter relevant out each time.

As for zooming, I remember it works in 0.5, at least. It is nice to have
that feature around, since sometime, the vibration in the network may cause
activation or parameters to reach a far larger value than the values when
the network stablizes. To be able to zoom in sometimes helps a lot,
otherwise, the stable values are indiscernable.

On 11 August 2016 at 01:26, Daniel W Mane notifications@github.com wrote:

> Zoom doesn't work on those histograms. That's currently working as
> intended. In a future release, we will rename the histograms to
> "distribution charts" and add in true histogram charts which are much
> nicer.
> 
> For the performance issues: in the future, we hope to improve performance
> for large numbers of charts in a single group, but it's not on the
> immediate roadmap. We are actively working on ways to make it easier to set
> up the tag groups.
> 
> You're right that the regex filter doesn't work on the histogram tab.
> We'll dig into it and report back.
> 
> —
